3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* postscreen 3h
6/* SUMMARY
7/* postscreen internal interfaces
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include <postscreen.h>
10/* DESCRIPTION
11/* .nf
12
13 /*
14 * System library.
15 */
16
17 /*
18 * Utility library.
19 */
20#include <dict_cache.h>
21#include <vstream.h>
22#include <vstring.h>
23#include <events.h>
24#include <htable.h>
25#include <myaddrinfo.h>
26
27 /*
28 * Global library.
29 */
30#include <addr_match_list.h>
31#include <string_list.h>
32#include <maps.h>
33#include <server_acl.h>
34
35 /*
36 * Preliminary stuff, to be fixed.
37 */
38#define PSC_READ_BUF_SIZE 1024
39
40 /*
41 * Numeric indices and symbolic names for tests whose time stamps and status
42 * flags can be accessed by numeric index.
43 */
44#define PSC_TINDX_PREGR 0 /* pregreet */
45#define PSC_TINDX_DNSBL 1 /* dnsbl */
46#define PSC_TINDX_PIPEL 2 /* pipelining */
47#define PSC_TINDX_NSMTP 3 /* non-smtp command */
48#define PSC_TINDX_BARLF 4 /* bare newline */
49#define PSC_TINDX_COUNT 5 /* number of tests */
50
51#define PSC_TNAME_PREGR "pregreet"
52#define PSC_TNAME_DNSBL "dnsbl"
53#define PSC_TNAME_PIPEL "pipelining"
54#define PSC_TNAME_NSMTP "non-smtp command"
55#define PSC_TNAME_BARLF "bare newline"
56
57#define PSC_TINDX_BYTNAME(tname) (PSC_TINDX_ ## tname)
58
59 /*
60 * Per-client shared state.
61 */
62typedef struct {
63 int concurrency; /* per-client */
64 int pass_new_count; /* per-client */
65 time_t expire_time[PSC_TINDX_COUNT]; /* per-test expiration */
66} PSC_CLIENT_INFO;
67
68 /*
69 * Per-session state.
70 */
71typedef struct {
72 int flags; /* see below */
73 /* Socket state. */
74 VSTREAM *smtp_client_stream; /* remote SMTP client */
75 int smtp_server_fd; /* real SMTP server */
76 char *smtp_client_addr; /* client address */
77 char *smtp_client_port; /* client port */
78 char *smtp_server_addr; /* server address */
79 char *smtp_server_port; /* server port */
80 const char *final_reply; /* cause for hanging up */
81 VSTRING *send_buf; /* pending output */
82 /* Test context. */
83 struct timeval start_time; /* start of current test */
84 const char *test_name; /* name of current test */
85 PSC_CLIENT_INFO *client_info; /* shared client state */
86 VSTRING *dnsbl_reply; /* dnsbl reject text */
87 int dnsbl_score; /* saved DNSBL score */
88 int dnsbl_ttl; /* saved DNSBL TTL */
89 const char *dnsbl_name; /* DNSBL name with largest weight */
90 int dnsbl_index; /* dnsbl request index */
91 const char *rcpt_reply; /* how to reject recipients */
92 int command_count; /* error + junk command count */
93 const char *protocol; /* SMTP or ESMTP */
94 char *helo_name; /* SMTP helo/ehlo */
95 char *sender; /* MAIL FROM */
96 VSTRING *cmd_buffer; /* command read buffer */
97 int read_state; /* command read state machine */
98 /* smtpd(8) compatibility */
99 int ehlo_discard_mask; /* EHLO filter */
100 VSTRING *expand_buf; /* macro expansion */
101 const char *where; /* SMTP protocol state */
102} PSC_STATE;
103
104 /*
105 * Emulate legacy ad-hoc variables on top of indexable time stamps. This
106 * avoids massive scar tissue during initial feature development.
107 */
108#define pregr_stamp client_info->expire_time[PSC_TINDX_PREGR]
109#define dnsbl_stamp client_info->expire_time[PSC_TINDX_DNSBL]
110#define pipel_stamp client_info->expire_time[PSC_TINDX_PIPEL]
111#define nsmtp_stamp client_info->expire_time[PSC_TINDX_NSMTP]
112#define barlf_stamp client_info->expire_time[PSC_TINDX_BARLF]
113
114 /* Minize the patch size for stable releases. */
115#define client_concurrency client_info->concurrency
116
117 /*
118 * Special expiration time values.
119 */
120#define PSC_TIME_STAMP_NEW (0) /* test was never passed */
121#define PSC_TIME_STAMP_DISABLED (1) /* never passed but disabled */
122#define PSC_TIME_STAMP_INVALID (-1) /* must not be cached */
123
124 /*
125 * Status flags.
126 */
127#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_NOFORWARD (1<<0) /* don't forward this session */
128#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_USING_TLS (1<<1) /* using the TLS proxy */
129#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_UNUSED2 (1<<2) /* use me! */
130#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_NEW (1<<3) /* some test was never passed */
131#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BLIST_FAIL (1<<4) /* blacklisted */
132#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_HANGUP (1<<5) /* NOT a test failure */
133#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_SMTPD_X21 (1<<6) /* hang up after command */
134#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_WLIST_FAIL (1<<7) /* do not whitelist */
135#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_TEST_BASE (8) /* start of indexable flags */
136
137 /*
138 * Tests whose flags and expiration time can be accessed by numerical index.
139 *
140 * Important: every MUMBLE_TODO flag must have a MUMBLE_PASS flag, such that
141 * MUMBLE_PASS == PSC_STATE_FLAGS_TODO_TO_PASS(MUMBLE_TODO).
142 *
143 * MUMBLE_TODO flags must not be cleared once raised. The _TODO_TO_PASS and
144 * _TODO_TO_DONE macros depend on this to decide that a group of tests is
145 * passed or completed.
146 *
147 * MUMBLE_DONE flags are used for "early" tests that have final results.
148 *
149 * MUMBLE_SKIP flags are used for "deep" tests where the client messed up.
150 * These flags look like MUMBLE_DONE but they are different. Deep tests can
151 * tentatively pass, but can still fail later in a session. The "ignore"
152 * action introduces an additional complication. MUMBLE_PASS indicates
153 * either that a deep test passed tentatively, or that the test failed but
154 * the result was ignored. MUMBLE_FAIL, on the other hand, is always final.
155 * We use MUMBLE_SKIP to indicate that a decision was either "fail" or
156 * forced "pass".
157 *
158 * The difference between DONE and SKIP is in the beholder's eye. These flags
159 * share the same bit.
160 */
161#define PSC_STATE_FLAGS_TODO_TO_PASS(todo_flags) ((todo_flags) >> 1)
162#define PSC_STATE_FLAGS_TODO_TO_DONE(todo_flags) ((todo_flags) << 1)
163
164#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_FAIL (0) /* failed test */
165#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_PASS (1) /* passed test */
166#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_TODO (2) /* expired test */
167#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_DONE (3) /* decision is final */
168#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_SKIP (3) /* action is already logged */
169#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_STRIDE (4) /* nr of flags per test */
170
171#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_BYFNAME(fname) (PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_ ## fname)
172
173 /*
174 * Indexable per-test flags. These are used for DNS whitelisting multiple
175 * tests, without needing per-test ad-hoc code.
176 */
177#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_FNAME(tindx, fname) \
178 (1U << (PSC_STATE_FLAG_TEST_BASE \
179 + PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_STRIDE * (tindx) \
180 + PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_BYFNAME(fname)))
181
182#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_FAIL(tindx) \
183 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_FNAME((tindx), FAIL)
184#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_PASS(tindx) \
185 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_FNAME((tindx), PASS)
186#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_TODO(tindx) \
187 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_FNAME((tindx), TODO)
188#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_DONE(tindx) \
189 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_FNAME((tindx), DONE)
190#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_SKIP(tindx) \
191 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTINDX_FNAME((tindx), SKIP)
192
193 /*
194 * Flags with distinct names. These are used in the per-test ad-hoc code.
195 */
196#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(tname, fname) \
197 (1U << (PSC_STATE_FLAG_TEST_BASE \
198 + PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_STRIDE * PSC_TINDX_BYTNAME(tname) \
199 + PSC_STATE_FLAG_SHIFT_BYFNAME(fname)))
200
201#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_FAIL PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(PREGR, FAIL)
202#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_PASS PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(PREGR, PASS)
203#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_TODO PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(PREGR, TODO)
204#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_DONE PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(PREGR, DONE)
205
206#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_FAIL PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(DNSBL, FAIL)
207#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_PASS PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(DNSBL, PASS)
208#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_TODO PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(DNSBL, TODO)
209#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_DONE PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(DNSBL, DONE)
210
211#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_FAIL PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(PIPEL, FAIL)
212#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_PASS PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(PIPEL, PASS)
213#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_TODO PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(PIPEL, TODO)
214#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_SKIP PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(PIPEL, SKIP)
215
216#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_FAIL PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(NSMTP, FAIL)
217#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_PASS PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(NSMTP, PASS)
218#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_TODO PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(NSMTP, TODO)
219#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_SKIP PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(NSMTP, SKIP)
220
221#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_FAIL PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(BARLF, FAIL)
222#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_PASS PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(BARLF, PASS)
223#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_TODO PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(BARLF, TODO)
224#define PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_SKIP PSC_STATE_FLAG_BYTNAME_FNAME(BARLF, SKIP)
225
226 /*
227 * Aggregates for individual tests.
228 */
229#define PSC_STATE_MASK_PREGR_TODO_FAIL \
230 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_TODO | PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_FAIL)
231#define PSC_STATE_MASK_DNSBL_TODO_FAIL \
232 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_TODO | PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_FAIL)
233#define PSC_STATE_MASK_PIPEL_TODO_FAIL \
234 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_TODO | PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_FAIL)
235#define PSC_STATE_MASK_NSMTP_TODO_FAIL \
236 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_TODO | PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_FAIL)
237#define PSC_STATE_MASK_BARLF_TODO_FAIL \
238 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_TODO | PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_FAIL)
239
240#define PSC_STATE_MASK_PREGR_TODO_DONE \
241 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_TODO | PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_DONE)
242#define PSC_STATE_MASK_PIPEL_TODO_SKIP \
243 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_TODO | PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_SKIP)
244#define PSC_STATE_MASK_NSMTP_TODO_SKIP \
245 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_TODO | PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_SKIP)
246#define PSC_STATE_MASK_BARLF_TODO_SKIP \
247 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_TODO | PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_SKIP)
248
249#define PSC_STATE_MASK_PREGR_FAIL_DONE \
250 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_FAIL | PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_DONE)
251
252#define PSC_STATE_MASK_PIPEL_TODO_PASS_FAIL \
253 (PSC_STATE_MASK_PIPEL_TODO_FAIL | PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_PASS)
254#define PSC_STATE_MASK_NSMTP_TODO_PASS_FAIL \
255 (PSC_STATE_MASK_NSMTP_TODO_FAIL | PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_PASS)
256#define PSC_STATE_MASK_BARLF_TODO_PASS_FAIL \
257 (PSC_STATE_MASK_BARLF_TODO_FAIL | PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_PASS)
258
259 /*
260 * Separate aggregates for early tests and deep tests.
261 */
262#define PSC_STATE_MASK_EARLY_DONE \
263 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_DONE | PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_DONE)
264#define PSC_STATE_MASK_EARLY_TODO \
265 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_TODO | PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_TODO)
266#define PSC_STATE_MASK_EARLY_PASS \
267 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_PASS | PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_PASS)
268#define PSC_STATE_MASK_EARLY_FAIL \
269 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_FAIL | PSC_STATE_FLAG_DNSBL_FAIL)
270
271#define PSC_STATE_MASK_SMTPD_TODO \
272 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_TODO | PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_TODO | \
273 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_TODO)
274#define PSC_STATE_MASK_SMTPD_PASS \
275 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_PASS | PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_PASS | \
276 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_PASS)
277#define PSC_STATE_MASK_SMTPD_FAIL \
278 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_FAIL | PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_FAIL | \
279 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_FAIL)
280
281 /*
282 * Super-aggregates for all tests combined.
283 */
284#define PSC_STATE_MASK_ANY_FAIL \
285 (PSC_STATE_FLAG_BLIST_FAIL | \
286 PSC_STATE_MASK_EARLY_FAIL | PSC_STATE_MASK_SMTPD_FAIL | \
287 PSC_STATE_FLAG_WLIST_FAIL)
288
289#define PSC_STATE_MASK_ANY_PASS \
290 (PSC_STATE_MASK_EARLY_PASS | PSC_STATE_MASK_SMTPD_PASS)
291
292#define PSC_STATE_MASK_ANY_TODO \
293 (PSC_STATE_MASK_EARLY_TODO | PSC_STATE_MASK_SMTPD_TODO)
294
295#define PSC_STATE_MASK_ANY_TODO_FAIL \
296 (PSC_STATE_MASK_ANY_TODO | PSC_STATE_MASK_ANY_FAIL)
297
298#define PSC_STATE_MASK_ANY_UPDATE \
299 (PSC_STATE_MASK_ANY_PASS)
300
301 /*
302 * Meta-commands for state->where that reflect the initial command processor
303 * state and commands that aren't implemented.
304 */
305#define PSC_SMTPD_CMD_CONNECT "CONNECT"
306#define PSC_SMTPD_CMD_UNIMPL "UNIMPLEMENTED"
307
308 /*
309 * See log_adhoc.c for discussion.
310 */
311typedef struct {
312 int dt_sec; /* make sure it's signed */
313 int dt_usec; /* make sure it's signed */
314} DELTA_TIME;
315
316#define PSC_CALC_DELTA(x, y, z) \
317 do { \
318 (x).dt_sec = (y).tv_sec - (z).tv_sec; \
319 (x).dt_usec = (y).tv_usec - (z).tv_usec; \
320 while ((x).dt_usec < 0) { \
321 (x).dt_usec += 1000000; \
322 (x).dt_sec -= 1; \
323 } \
324 while ((x).dt_usec >= 1000000) { \
325 (x).dt_usec -= 1000000; \
326 (x).dt_sec += 1; \
327 } \
328 if ((x).dt_sec < 0) \
329 (x).dt_sec = (x).dt_usec = 0; \
330 } while (0)
331
332#define SIG_DIGS 2
333
334 /*
335 * Event management.
336 */
337
338/* PSC_READ_EVENT_REQUEST - prepare for transition to next state */
339
340#define PSC_READ_EVENT_REQUEST(fd, action, context, timeout) do { \
341 if (msg_verbose > 1) \
342 msg_info("%s: read-request fd=%d", myname, (fd)); \
343 event_enable_read((fd), (action), (context)); \
344 event_request_timer((action), (context), (timeout)); \
345 } while (0)
346
347#define PSC_READ_EVENT_REQUEST2(fd, read_act, time_act, context, timeout) do { \
348 if (msg_verbose > 1) \
349 msg_info("%s: read-request fd=%d", myname, (fd)); \
350 event_enable_read((fd), (read_act), (context)); \
351 event_request_timer((time_act), (context), (timeout)); \
352 } while (0)
353
354/* PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_REQUEST - complete state transition */
355
356#define PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_REQUEST(fd, time_act, context) do { \
357 if (msg_verbose > 1) \
358 msg_info("%s: clear-request fd=%d", myname, (fd)); \
359 event_disable_readwrite(fd); \
360 event_cancel_timer((time_act), (context)); \
361 } while (0)
362
363 /*
364 * Failure enforcement policies.
365 */
366#define PSC_NAME_ACT_DROP "drop"
367#define PSC_NAME_ACT_ENFORCE "enforce"
368#define PSC_NAME_ACT_IGNORE "ignore"
369#define PSC_NAME_ACT_CONT "continue"
370
371#define PSC_ACT_DROP 1
372#define PSC_ACT_ENFORCE 2
373#define PSC_ACT_IGNORE 3
374
375 /*
376 * Global variables.
377 */
378extern int psc_check_queue_length; /* connections being checked */
379extern int psc_post_queue_length; /* being sent to real SMTPD */
380extern DICT_CACHE *psc_cache_map; /* cache table handle */
381extern VSTRING *psc_temp; /* scratchpad */
382extern char *psc_smtpd_service_name; /* path to real SMTPD */
383extern int psc_pregr_action; /* PSC_ACT_DROP etc. */
384extern int psc_dnsbl_action; /* PSC_ACT_DROP etc. */
385extern int psc_pipel_action; /* PSC_ACT_DROP etc. */
386extern int psc_nsmtp_action; /* PSC_ACT_DROP etc. */
387extern int psc_barlf_action; /* PSC_ACT_DROP etc. */
388extern int psc_min_ttl; /* Update with new tests! */
389extern STRING_LIST *psc_forbid_cmds; /* CONNECT GET POST */
390extern int psc_stress_greet_wait; /* stressed greet wait */
391extern int psc_normal_greet_wait; /* stressed greet wait */
392extern int psc_stress_cmd_time_limit; /* stressed command limit */
393extern int psc_normal_cmd_time_limit; /* normal command time limit */
394extern int psc_stress; /* stress level */
395extern int psc_lowat_check_queue_length;/* stress low-water mark */
396extern int psc_hiwat_check_queue_length;/* stress high-water mark */
397extern DICT *psc_dnsbl_reply; /* DNSBL name mapper */
398extern HTABLE *psc_client_concurrency; /* per-client concurrency */
399
400#define PSC_EFF_GREET_WAIT \
401 (psc_stress ? psc_stress_greet_wait : psc_normal_greet_wait)
402#define PSC_EFF_CMD_TIME_LIMIT \
403 (psc_stress ? psc_stress_cmd_time_limit : psc_normal_cmd_time_limit)

405 /*
406 * String plumbing macros.
407 */
408#define PSC_STRING_UPDATE(str, text) do { \
409 if (str) myfree(str); \
410 (str) = ((text) ? mystrdup(text) : 0); \
411 } while (0)
412
413#define PSC_STRING_RESET(str) do { \
414 if (str) { \
415 myfree(str); \
416 (str) = 0; \
417 } \
418 } while (0)
419
420 /*
421 * SLMs.
422 */
423#define STR(x) vstring_str(x)
424#define LEN(x) VSTRING_LEN(x)
425
426 /*
427 * postscreen_state.c
428 */
429#define PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state) \
430 (state)->smtp_client_addr, (state)->smtp_client_port
431
432#define PSC_PASS_SESSION_STATE(state, what, bits) do { \
433 if (msg_verbose) \
434 msg_info("PASS %s [%s]:%s", (what), PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state)); \
435 (state)->flags |= (bits); \
436 } while (0)
437#define PSC_FAIL_SESSION_STATE(state, bits) do { \
438 if (msg_verbose) \
439 msg_info("FAIL [%s]:%s", PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state)); \
440 (state)->flags |= (bits); \
441 } while (0)
442#define PSC_SKIP_SESSION_STATE(state, what, bits) do { \
443 if (msg_verbose) \
444 msg_info("SKIP %s [%s]:%s", (what), PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state)); \
445 (state)->flags |= (bits); \
446 } while (0)
447#define PSC_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state, reply) do { \
448 if (msg_verbose) \
449 msg_info("DROP [%s]:%s", PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state)); \
450 (state)->flags |= PSC_STATE_FLAG_NOFORWARD; \
451 (state)->final_reply = (reply); \
452 psc_conclude(state); \
453 } while (0)
454#define PSC_ENFORCE_SESSION_STATE(state, reply) do { \
455 if (msg_verbose) \
456 msg_info("ENFORCE [%s]:%s", PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state)); \
457 (state)->rcpt_reply = (reply); \
458 (state)->flags |= PSC_STATE_FLAG_NOFORWARD; \
459 } while (0)
460#define PSC_UNPASS_SESSION_STATE(state, bits) do { \
461 if (msg_verbose) \
462 msg_info("UNPASS [%s]:%s", PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state)); \
463 (state)->flags &= ~(bits); \
464 } while (0)
465#define PSC_UNFAIL_SESSION_STATE(state, bits) do { \
466 if (msg_verbose) \
467 msg_info("UNFAIL [%s]:%s", PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state)); \
468 (state)->flags &= ~(bits); \
469 } while (0)
470#define PSC_ADD_SERVER_STATE(state, fd) do { \
471 (state)->smtp_server_fd = (fd); \
472 psc_post_queue_length++; \
473 } while (0)
474#define PSC_DEL_CLIENT_STATE(state) do { \
475 event_server_disconnect((state)->smtp_client_stream); \
476 (state)->smtp_client_stream = 0; \
477 psc_check_queue_length--; \
478 } while (0)
479extern PSC_STATE *psc_new_session_state(VSTREAM *, const char *, const char *, const char *, const char *);
480extern void psc_free_session_state(PSC_STATE *);
481extern const char *psc_print_state_flags(int, const char *);

486extern int psc_addr_match_list_match(ADDR_MATCH_LIST *, const char *);
487extern const char *psc_cache_lookup(DICT_CACHE *, const char *);
488extern void psc_cache_update(DICT_CACHE *, const char *, const char *);
489const char *psc_dict_get(DICT *, const char *);
490const char *psc_maps_find(MAPS *, const char *, int);

492 /*
493 * postscreen_dnsbl.c
494 */
495extern void psc_dnsbl_init(void);
496extern int psc_dnsbl_retrieve(const char *, const char **, int, int *);
497extern int psc_dnsbl_request(const char *, void (*) (int, void *), void *);
498
499 /*
500 * postscreen_tests.c
501 */
502#define PSC_INIT_TESTS(dst) do { \
503 time_t *_it_stamp_p; \
504 (dst)->flags = 0; \
505 for (_it_stamp_p = (dst)->client_info->expire_time; \
506 _it_stamp_p < (dst)->client_info->expire_time + PSC_TINDX_COUNT; \
507 _it_stamp_p++) \
508 *_it_stamp_p = PSC_TIME_STAMP_INVALID; \
509 } while (0)
510#define PSC_INIT_TEST_FLAGS_ONLY(dst) do { \
511 (dst)->flags = 0; \
512 } while (0)
513#define PSC_BEGIN_TESTS(state, name) do { \
514 (state)->test_name = (name); \
515 GETTIMEOFDAY(&(state)->start_time); \
516 } while (0)
517extern void psc_new_tests(PSC_STATE *);
518extern void psc_parse_tests(PSC_STATE *, const char *, time_t);
519extern void psc_todo_tests(PSC_STATE *, time_t);
520extern char *psc_print_tests(VSTRING *, PSC_STATE *);
521extern char *psc_print_grey_key(VSTRING *, const char *, const char *,
522 const char *, const char *);
523extern const char *psc_test_name(int);
524
525#define PSC_MIN(x, y) ((x) < (y) ? (x) : (y))
526#define PSC_MAX(x, y) ((x) > (y) ? (x) : (y))

539extern void psc_smtpd_pre_jail_init(void);

541#define PSC_SMTPD_X21(state, reply) do { \
542 (state)->flags |= PSC_STATE_FLAG_SMTPD_X21; \
543 (state)->final_reply = (reply); \
544 psc_smtpd_tests(state); \
545 } while (0)
